title: Wend
author: Wend
content: Today, Vitalik's (ETHEREUM founder) account was hacked and the account posted an article with a mint NFT Phishing link. Soon after, the post was deleted but there is still no accurate information about whether Vitalik has gotten his account back or not. And there is also some information that more than 700 thousand USD was hacked when users clicked on the link. Scam wallet: 0x4eF6f0d3f94fF609ACef88068b1FC66a1184b3f3People should be careful not to click on any link on any social platform, there is no free meal, the only free things are rainwater and bird droppings.image source: x.com

comments.author: Gladitorcomeback
comments.body: Yes that's true and confirmed by many influencers and unfortunately greedy people once against lost big fund. How many times this issue happened and many big twitter account including Vitalik, Layerzero has been compromised and people still blindly connecting account without any research. When I waked up , I saw this news but when i checked twitter then found nothing in Vitalik twitter profile. This hacked was for short time and I think now Vitalik again recovered the accountHere is some safety tips shared by one of the top influencers OlimpioQuoteProtecting your X accountGuide:Step 1) Go to SettingsStep 2) Go to Security and account accessStep 3) Go to SecurityStep 4) Go to Two-factor authenticationStep 5) DISABLE Text message authenticationStep 6) ENABLE Authentication app and/or Security key QuoteProtecting your WalletSecurity browser extensions such as Blowfish, Stelo, Wallet Guard, Fire, Pocket Universe, and Revoke cash, would have most likely blocked the domain and/or detected the malicious contract.Source link

comments.author: albon
comments.body: An unfortunate accident. Vitalik Buterin is a famous public figure in the field of cryptocurrencies. He co-founded Ethereum and has 4.9M Followers on his account on the X platform. The followers of the hacked Vitalik account have lost vast amounts of money and dozens of expensive NFTs like the CryptoPunk NFT collection. Sad about these immense losses for the victims, but this is a harsh lesson we learn from it that no one should open any malicious link on account of any famous and influential person if he finds a tweet for Giveaway or a mint of Free NFTs while seeing the comments button closed, also accounts like @ZachXBT on X platform who is a Blockchain investigator and those who constantly uncover scams and scammers' activities are the first to be followed up by us to remain vigilant in the event of any mysterious incidents.SOURCE: https://twitter.com/zachxbt

comments.author: Latviand
comments.body: Quote from: albon on September 10, 2023, 03:34:09 AMAn unfortunate accident. Vitalik Buterin is a famous public figure in the field of cryptocurrencies. That's why it's no surprise to me that for how long the link was open, they were able to steal 700k USD already. It just saddens me that Twitter/X as a platform is no longer a safe space because everyone's trying to scam someone there, it's not worth to sift through the muck that we call a social platform, hopefully Vitalik's image won't be damaged as much because as much as we know that it's not his fault since his account got hacked, there's definitely a goofbrain out there that got scammed that will definitely blame Vitalik.

comments.author: LoyceMobile
comments.body: That guy never had your interests in mind anyway, so I really don't get why people worship him.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceMobile on September 10, 2023, 05:38:30 AMThat guy never had your interests in mind anyway, so I really don't get why people worship him.I will agree. This is not new again. I mean it is not new again that Twitter account of people like Vitalik Buterin are hacked. It occur almost all the time. I will not blame Twitter because people can use 2FA like Aegis with their Twitter account. Another option is the use of security key. If these can be on Twitter to secure your account and people like Ethereum founder and other crypto well known people continue to remain careless for hackers to scam people using their account, I too will say they do not care about their followers.

comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: What strikes me about this is that he's not just any old nerd: gifted child, cryptographer, former board of directors chairman of the Tor Project, won a bronze medal in the International Olympiad in Informatics in Italy, about $0.6B of net worth....If they can hack his accounts, they can hack any of us. I guess the only difference is that hackers don't find us interesting. Quote from: Wend on September 10, 2023, 02:12:19 AM0x4eF6f0d3f94fF609ACef88068b1FC66a1184b3f3There are many movements in that address, all from today. I guess the scammers are getting their rewards.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Poker Player on September 10, 2023, 07:38:58 AMIf they can hack his accounts, they can hack any of us. I guess the only difference is that hackers don't find us interesting.When people become big they don't have time to maintain their social network. They hire people to manage those networks and they get paid a lot of money for doing it. So when a celebrity or a person with huge influence get their account hacked, it does not make me surprise. On the other hand, you, me, and others who have enough time for us keep our things [if we are in social media] in our hand. If this is important to us then we use every security measures available like 2FA and things.I do not think a social media account for VITALIK and other high end influencers have any importance. Quote from: Charles-Tim on September 10, 2023, 06:36:02 AMEthereum founder and other crypto well known people continue to remain careless for hackers to scam people using their account, I too will say they do not care about their followers.Obviously they are not in control of their own social accounts. As explained above.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: I do not think that a person like VITALIK would forget to perform a simple setting such as two-factor authentication, and I do not think that his tweets indicate that there is another person managing that account, and therefore such hackers may be a social attack or due to the lack of Twitter staff or someone trying to send him a message.What surprises me is that if accounts are so easily hacked, how do they protect their data? That is to say, we have not heard of any famous person’s data being leaked or even a report of the loss of currencies, so the matter is a little confusing as it is either a lack of interest on their part or a problem with all social media applications.

comments.author: crwth
comments.body: This is where you can see that people are not doing their strategy to understand the thing they are investing it. They are blindly following someone that is influential on the cryptocurrency space but not really about advises. I believe everyone should be able to have their opinion and know what they are investing. It should always be DYOR.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: why do people not think before they act, I am not surprised that there are people who fell for the scam especially if they are new to cryptocurrency but for the love of god, this type of hack and scam has been happening and is well documented on the internet, especially in the crypto community, why can't people just do a bit of research or be more cautious, doing both of that would save them a lot of headache.anway, looks like the tweet has been deleted now but I don't know if Vitalik has recovered his account back.

comments.body: Quote from: acroman08 on September 10, 2023, 01:43:49 PMwhy do people not think before they act, I am not surprised that there are people who fell for the scam especially if they are new to cryptocurrency but for the love of god, this type of hack and scam has been happening and is well documented on the internet, especially in the crypto community, why can't people just do a bit of research or be more cautious, doing both of that would save them a lot of headache.There’s a lot of blind follower on twitter which they can easily send money to a random address given by the twitter account of their social media influencer that they are following in return for a possible profit since there’s a lot of unexpected profit before on crypto like airdrops comes from random trading on DEX and many more.I remember reading a tweet of popular influencer of shitcoin that drop an eth address with a description of send money here to be scam and he still get millions of dollar since many of his follower is very hungry to invest early on one of his meme coin that print a huge profit. So yeah, Social media people like on twitter are the worst that’s why scammer are feeding on their money.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Quote from: Wend on September 10, 2023, 02:12:19 AMPeople should be careful not to click on any link on any social platform, there is no free meal, the only free things are rainwater and bird droppings.Same happen like this forum, if there's a trusted user want to trade with you and he ask you to send first, you must ask him to sign a message.This applicable to trusted non custodial wallet too, if the site is hacked and you downloaded a fake wallet, anything that valuable in your device would gone. That's why you must prepare to download the wallet in secondary device and verify the key.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Wend on September 10, 2023, 02:12:19 AMPeople should be careful not to click on any link on any social platform, there is no free meal, the only free things are rainwater and bird droppings.This just proved that even notable personality's accounts can be hacked so it's always important to apply all the necessary measures when checking posts coming from personalities you're following, you are in a Cryptocurrency environment where hackers are actively hacking notable people to deceive their followers.People have so much trust in Vitalik that over $691,000 was lost by victims by clicking that malicious link, it's easy to lose everything with one click so avoid interacting with your wallet and keep your system free, every day security should be our main concern, even when we surf the clean site you just never know what lies ahead.

comments.author: JollyGood
comments.body: As you mentioned we have not heard of data belonging to famous people being leaked, it raises a question about why private exchanges via DM have not been released from hacked X accounts. I suppose there is a difference between hacking to steal funds and hacking to steal private messages with intent to blackmail.Hackers that target X seem to show no interest in accessing DMs which could be a lucrative business for them. If the hack is server based and not related to a password being used, that could explain part of the issue but it is surprising. Quote from: hugeblack on September 10, 2023, 09:48:44 AMWhat surprises me is that if accounts are so easily hacked, how do they protect their data? That is to say, we have not heard of any famous person’s data being leaked or even a report of the loss of currencies, so the matter is a little confusing as it is either a lack of interest on their part or a problem with all social media applications.

In any case, the financial condition of neither Musk nor Buterin will not suffer much from this.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Confirmed: Vitalik Buterin was SIM-swapped (and got his number back): https://www.reddit.com/r/CryptoCurrency/comments/16gfkil/so_it_turns_out_vitalik_was_actually_simswapped/His session cookies were NOT swiped.The kicker here is that none of this would've happened if he had 2FA OTP enabled on his account.I mean, I can't really blame him for that, I don't have OTP on Twitter either, but then again, I'm not a huge target for criminal entrepreneurs. I really think people like Vitalik should have OTP on their social media at all times.

comments.body: SIM swap attack is not new type of attack and surprised that a man like Vitalik got hack with this method.SIM swap attack (SIM intercept attack). How to prevent it.The Most Expensive Lesson Of My Life: Details of SIM port hack.
